jobDescription: Drift’s Smart Grid Research Intern will be primarily responsible for identifying public/private grant opportunities in the Smart Grid and Renewable Energy industry, perform analysis to support the grant, and managing the grant development and proposal process with support from Drift’s R&D; team. Secondary responsibilities include assisting the R&D; team with research, data analysis, and development related to Drift’s products. This is a paid internship in Seattle, WA.  Candidates must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, a professional and resourceful demeanor, the ability to work both independently and as a team player, and a desire to take initiative and manage numerous projects simultaneously.
